result.execSummary:
The defendant Amy L Hunter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 10/01/2015 and each month thereafter or penalty of 9 days jail for non-payment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amy L Hunter

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Dated 11/24/15, from the Court to the Defendant, in response to request dated 11/06/15 requesting to lower payments for financial obligation. Request granted, payments are now $25.00 per month. (Clerk called Business Center to inform)
Dated 11/09/15, from the Defendant, requesting lower payments for financial obligation related to this case.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Amy L Hunter in court with Attorney Peter M Wolff.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #2.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #2.  Count #1 is dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendation.  Attorney Wolff makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #2:  FINE:  $442.00 - to be paid at $50.00 per month, commencing 10/1/15, alternate 9 days jail if not paid.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
Jury trial - 12 person on September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on September 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Peter M Wolff in court.   Defendant Amy L Hunter did not appear.   Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Attorney Woff requests a jury status and jury trial date.   Bail remains as fixed.  Jury status hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
to appear filed by Attorney Peter Wolff

Attorney Peter M Wolff in court.   Defendant Amy L Hunter did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Becky Van Dam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Wolff requests an adjournment.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant to have no contact with victim/witnesses listed in the Criminal Complaint except for her son.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.
Defendant Amy L Hunter in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
